, not to be confused with its near-namesake

value: Drive from any point along the East Coast Highway or take a bus from

Swim at the local beach or take a stroll from the bridge crossing the waterway, passing a few seaside village houses, and come back via a wooden bridge a few hundred meters away. Lovely scenery here.

Drive around and visit fishing villages. Fishing boats seen from the jetty to Pulau Kapas can be reached via the trunk road to the south, crossing the river, and turning left towards east.
Marang has a small but good pasar (bazaar) near the ferry landing. Get some bananas, rambutan, etc.
Local Malay fare and roti canai (flipped pancake) available.
Seri Malaysia Hotel - small swimming pool, breakfast for two included
